intro: Dryandra fililoba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is typically shrub-like, with a compact growth habit and dense foliage. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
